intro: Telinaria pilosa, commonly known as the hairy telinaria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in umbels. Telinaria pilosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
